clue: Software that is designed to deal with malicious software.
A network of infected devices, connected to the Internet, used to commit coordinated cyber attacks.
An incident in computer systems are accessed or affected in a non-authorised way.
A form of digital identity for a computer, user or organisation to allow the authentication and secure exchange of information.
Shared compute and storage resources that are accessed as an online service.
A user's authentication information used to verify identity.
A list of words, phrases or common passwords used as guesses in an attack.
When legitimate users are denied access to computer services.
A mathematical function that protects information by making it unreadable by everyone except those with the key to decode it.
Taking advantage of a vulnerability in a system to cause unintended consequences.
Hardware or software which uses a defined rule set to constrain network traffic.
Someone with some computer skills that uses them to break into computers, systems and networks.
Decoy system or network to attract potential attackers that helps limit access to actual systems by detecting and deflecting or learning from an attack.
A breach of the security rules for a system or service.
A small program that can automate tasks in applications (such as Microsoft Office) which attackers can use to gain access to (or harm) a system.
Using online advertising as a delivery method for malware.
Malicious software - a term that includes viruses, trojans, worms or any code or content that could have an adverse impact on organisations or individuals.
Two or more computers linked in order to share resources.
Applying updates to firmware or software to improve security and/or enhance functionality.
An authorised test of a computer network or system designed to look for security weaknesses so that they can be fixed.
Untargeted, mass emails sent to many people asking for sensitive information (such as bank details) or encouraging them to visit a fake website.
Malicious software that makes data or systems unusable until the victim makes a payment.
A network device which sends data packets from one network to another based on the destination address. May also be called a gateway.
Manipulating people into carrying out specific actions or divulging information.
A type of malware or virus disguised as legitimate software.
A weakness, or flaw, in software, a system or process.
Setting up a fake website (or compromising a real one) in order to exploit visiting users.
Highly targeted phishing attacks that are aimed at senior executives.
Authorising approved applications for use within organisations.
An exploit that is not yet known to vendors or antivirus companies.
